title: [K-12] Constructivist Simulation-Based Instructional Design for Chromosomal Abnormality Diagnosis

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of cell division processes, basic genetics concepts, Mendelian inheritance laws, and chromosome structure
context.additional_context: Program aimed at strengthening science instruction competencies for pre-service/in-service teachers, with a practice-oriented environment utilizing digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can accurately diagnose chromosomal abnormality types of three virtual patients and explain related phenotypic features.
Learners can visualize and explain the mechanism of chromosomal abnormalities caused by nondisjunction during meiosis.
Learners can analyze genetic phenomena based on chromosome theory and develop instructional strategies applicable in educational contexts.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
